Examples of Combat

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

This page is intended to make understanding the Combat system easier.

We will use the characters Eric, Julian, Gerard, and Dierdre for the following examples. For consistency, the relevant parts of their character sheets and equipment are listed first.

As the Crafting system is not complete, certain variables are assumed, such as all materials possessing a malleability of 1.

It is also worth noting that some experience examples are absent, including those for Armor Proficiency, Dodge, Block, and Parry. This should be corrected soon.

Characters used for examples

Eric

Abilities

  • Strength; 4
  • Endurance; 5
  • Agility; 4
  • Speed; 3
  • Sapience; 3
  • Resolve; 3

Resources

  • Hit Points; 5
  • Stamina; 50
  • Willpower; 30

Skills

  • Block; 5
  • Dodge; 0
  • Parry; 5
  • Armor Proficiency; 5
  • Sword (one handed); 5
    • Specialization (shortsword); 10

Equipment

Eric wears leather armor and wields a Shortsword and shield.

Leather Armor

  • Mobility; 100
  • Hardness; 1
  • Quality; 100
  • Bulk; 0
  • Toughness; 1
  • Durability; 3

Shortword

  • Skill Bonus(es); Parry +2
  • Base Damage; 3
  • Weight; 2
  • Heft; 2

Shield

  • Mobility; 75
  • Hardness; 3
  • Quality; 100
  • Bulk; 2
  • Toughness; 1
  • Durability; 3
  • Skill Bonus; Block +5

Gerard

Abilities

  • Strength; 5
  • Endurance; 4
  • Agility; 3
  • Speed; 3
  • Sapience; 3
  • Resolve; 4

Resources

  • Hit points; 4
  • Stamina; 40
  • Willpower; 40

Skills

  • Block; 0
  • Dodge; 0
  • Parry; 8
  • Armor Proficiency; 5
    • Platemail; 15
  • Axe (two handed); 8
    • Specialization (splortstick); 10

Equipment

Gerard wears plate armor, wields a two-handed hammer.

Plate Armor

  • Mobility; 25
  • Hardness; 7
  • Quality; 100
  • Bulk; 6
  • Toughness; 4
  • Durability; 11

Two Handed Hammer

  • Base Damage; 10
  • Weight; 7
  • Heft; 5

Julian

Abilities

  • Strength; 4
  • Endurance; 4
  • Agility; 5
  • Speed; 3
  • Sapience; 3
  • Resolve; 3

Resources

  • Hit points; 4

  • Willpower; 30

  • Block; 5
  • Dodge; 0
  • Parry; 0
  • Armor Proficiency; 8
    • Specialization; Platemail; 32
  • Sword (one handed); 5
    • Specialization; longsword; 10

Equipment

Julian wears plate armor, and carries a sword and shield.

Plate Armor

  • Mobility; 25
  • Hardness; 7
  • Quality; 100
  • Bulk; 6
  • Toughness; 4
  • Durability; 11

longword

  • Skill Bonus(es); Parry +4
  • Base Damage; 5
  • Quality; 100
  • Weight; 3
  • Heft; 3
  • Durability; 2

Shield

  • Mobility; 75
  • Hardness; 3
  • Quality; 100
  • Bulk; 2
  • Toughness; 1
  • Durability; 3
  • Skill Bonus; Block +5

Dierdre

Abilities

  • Strength; 3
  • Endurance; 3
  • Agility; 5
  • Speed; 4
  • Sapience; 3
  • Resolve; 4

Resources

  • Hit points; 3
  • Stamina; 30
  • Willpower; 40

Skills

  • Block; 0
  • Dodge; 7
  • Parry; 0
  • Armor Proficiency; 0
  • Bow; 5
    • Shortbow; 15

Equipment

Dierdre wears no armor. She has a shortbow, some spare bowstrings, and a quiver of arrows.

Shortbow

  • Base Damage; 1
  • Weight; 1
  • Heft; 1
  • Pull; 4
  • Range; 3

Arrows

  • Base Damage; 1
  • Weight; 1
  • Heft; 1
  • Range; 3

Bowstrings

  • Weight; --
  • Heft; --
  • Pull; 4

Example 1; Attacking Various Targets at Range

Dierdre attacks Eric

Dierdre aims at Eric from 50m away.

  • Spends Heft (2)/Strength(3) in Stamina.
    • Heft of Ammunition(1) + Bow (1)
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Dierdre now has 29 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(5)*(Skill(5)+Specialization(15))=100
    • No armor, thus no Bulk.


Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(4) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(5) + (Armor Hardness (4) *Quality(1) * Armor proficiency percent(.05))0 =20
    • Parry uses only 1/4 ranks against ranged attacks.
    • Block uses standard ranks.
    • Agility(4) is greater than Sapience (3)
    • Mobility(100) is (significantly) greater than Agility.
    • Bulk(0) does not impact the calculation.
    • Hardness of the Shield and Leather Armor are combined.

Determine Range penalty

Target Range (50) / (bow range(3)*ammunition range(3))=5

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(100%) – base defense (20) – range penalty (5)=75% chance to hit.
    • There is also a 7% chance of critical hit, and a random number of 72-82 will grant Dierdre an experience point toward her skill.

Random number is generated

49.
  • Dierdre hits, but does not gain experience or inflict a critical hit.

Deal Damage

Assuming a starting quality of 100 for the bow, bowstring, and arrow;

  • Base Damage (2) + Strength (3)= 5 * (actual chance to hit (75%) – Random number (49) )(.26)= 1.3 * Weapon Quality (100%)=1.3. Rounded up to 2.
    • Base Damage is Ammunition(1) + Bow (1) =2
  • Eric’s health; Eric has 5 hit points himself, and has an additional 2 hit points from his armor (leather armor(1)+ shield(1)). His Shield and Armor have their Toughness reduced by one (to 0), but leaving Eric himself unharmed.

Calculate new Quality

Dierdre’s Bow

The roll was not a 1, the bow’s quality does not decrease.

Dierdre’s Bowstring

The string’s quality decreases by the roll (49)*.01=.49, and is now 99.51

Eric’s Armor

A successful blow reduces armor’s Quality by Damage(1)* .01%*Malleability(1)=.01 Eric’s Armor now has Quality 99.99.


Wait Before Next Attack

Dierdre must now wait Heft (2)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.

Dierdre attacks Gerard

Assuming that as soon as her wait is over Dierdre turns and attacks Gerard at 100m

Dierdre aims at Gerard

  • Spends Heft (2)/Strength(3) in Stamina.
    • Heft of Ammunition(1) + Bow (1)
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Dierdre now has 28 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(5)*(Skill(5)+Specialization(15))=100
    • No armor, thus no Bulk.


Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(3) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(2) + (Armor Hardness (7) * Quality(1) * (Armor proficiency percent(.05)+Specialization percent (.15))(1.4) =7
    • Parry uses only 1/4 ranks against ranged attacks.
    • Agility(3) is equal to Sapience (3)
    • Mobility(25) is (significantly) greater than Agility, and would not matter as Sapience is equal.
    • Bulk(6) does not impact the calculation.

Determine Range penalty

Target Range (100) / (bow range(3)*ammunition range(3))=11

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(100%) – base defense (7) – range penalty (11)=82% chance to hit.
    • There is also a 8% chance of critical hit, and a random number of 80-90 will grant Dierdre an experience point toward her skill.

Random number is generated

14.

  • Dierdre hits, but does not gain experience or inflict a critical hit.

Deal Damage

The bow retains a 100 Quality, however Dierdre’s bowstring has degraded to 99.51

  • Base Damage (2) + Strength (3)= 5 * (actual chance to hit (82%) – Random number (14%) )(.68)= 3.4 * Weapon Quality (99.51%)=3.38. Rounded up to 4.
    • Base Damage is Ammunition(1) + Bow (1) =2
  • Gerard’s health; Gerard has 4 hit points himself, and has an additional 4 hit points from his armor. His Armor has its Toughness reduced by 4 (to 0), leaving Gerard unharmed.

Calculate new Quality

Dierdre’s Bow

The roll was not a 1, the bow’s quality does not decrease.

Dierdre’s Bowstring

The string’s quality decreases by the roll (14)*.01=.14, and is now 99.37

Gerard’s Armor

A successful blow reduces armor’s Quality by Damage(3)* .01%*Malleability(1)=.03 Gerard’s Armor now has Quality 99.97.

Wait Before Next Attack

Dierdre must now wait Heft (2)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.

Dierdre attacks Julian

Assuming that as soon as her wait is over Dierdre turns and attacks Julian at 200m

Dierdre aims at Julian

  • Spends Heft (2)/Strength(3) in Stamina.
    • Heft of Ammunition(1) + Bow (1)
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Dierdre now has 27 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(5)*(Skill(5)+Specialization(15))=100
    • No armor, thus no Bulk.


Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(5) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(5) + (Armor Hardness (7) * Quality(1) * (Armor proficiency percent(.08)+Specialization percent (.32))(2.8) =27
    • Agility(5) is greater than Sapience (3)
    • Mobility(25) is (significantly) greater than Agility.
    • Bulk(6) does not impact the calculation.

Determine Range penalty

Target Range (200) / (bow range(3)*ammunition range(3))=22

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(100%) – base defense (27) – range penalty (22)=51% chance to hit. **There is also a 5% chance of critical hit, and a random number of 46-56 will grant Dierdre an experience point toward her skill.

Random number is generated

52.

  • Dierdre misses, but does gain a point of experience towards her skill and specialization (neither increase Rank however).

Deal Damage

Julian suffers no damage from a missed attack.

Calculate new Quality

Dierdre’s Bow

The roll was not a 1, the bow’s quality does not decrease.

Dierdre’s Bowstring

The string’s quality decreases by the roll (52)*.01=.52, and is now 98.85

Julian’s Armor

Had the blow missed by more than 2 points there would be no degradation to Julian’s armor. However, such a near miss does reduce his armor’s Quality.

Without Julian’s armor Dierdre’s attack would have succeeded by her roll (52)-Dierdre’s chance to hit without Julian’s armor (50) = 2.

Julian’s Armor has its quality reduced by the needed bonus(2) * .1= .2 and is now 99.8.


Wait Before Next Attack

Dierdre must now wait Heft (2)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.

Having now shot several melee combatants and having little or no melee capability herself, Dierdre wisely chooses to run away.

Example 2; Melee

Eric attacks Gerard

Eric aims at Gerard

  • Spends Heft (2)/Strength(4) in Stamina.
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Eric now has 49 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(4)*(Skill(5)+Specialization(10))=60
    • Consider Bulk of Leather armor (0): action continues without interference.

Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(3) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(8) + (Armor Hardness (7) * Quality(99.97) * (Armor proficiency percent(.08)+Specialization percent (.32))(2.7) =26
    • Mobility(25) is (significantly) greater than Agility.

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(60) –defense (26) =34% chance to hit. **There is also a 3% chance of critical hit, and a random number of 27-37 will grant Eric an experience point toward his skill.

Random number is generated

44.

  • Eric misses, and does not gain a point of experience towards his skill.

Deal Damage

Gerard suffers no damage from a missed attack.

Calculate new Quality

Eric’s Sword

The attack missed, Eric’s sword’s quality is not decreased.

Gerard’s Armor

Had the blow struck, or been closer to striking, there would be degradation to Gerard’s armor. However, such a miss does not reduce his armor’s Quality.

Wait Before Next Attack

Eric must now wait Heft (2)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.

Gerard attacks Eric

Gerard aims at Eric

  • Spends Heft (5)/Strength(5) in Stamina.
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Gerard now has 39 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(3)*(Skill(8)+Specialization(10))=54
    • Consider Bulk of Plate armor (6) –Armor Proficiency (5)= 1% chance of failure.
      • random number (13)> chance of failure(1), action proceeds without being hindered.
      • Functionally identical to 99% chance of success, in which case a roll of 98-100 will grant a point of experience towards Armor Proficiency.

Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(4) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(7) + (Armor Hardness (1) * *Quality(99.97%) * (Armor proficiency percent(.05))(.049) =28
    • Mobility(25) is (significantly) greater than Agility.
    • Eric’s base skill in Parry(5) receives a +2 bonus from his short sword.

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(54) –defense (28) =26% chance to hit.
    • There is a 2% chance of a critical hit and a random number of 18-28 will grant Gerard an experience point toward his skill.

Random number is generated

2

  • Gerard hits, and gets a Critical Hit
  • He does not gain a point of experience towards his skill.

Deal Damage

  • Base Damage (5) + Strength (5)= 10 * (actual chance to hit (26%) – Random number (2) )(.24)= 2.4 * Weapon Quality (100%)=2.4. Rounded up 3.
  • As this is a Critical Hit, damage(3) is doubled=6.
  • Eric’s health; Eric has 5 hit points himself, and has no additional Toughness remaining from either his leather armor or shield. Eric’s 5 hit points are eradicated by Gerard, and he is abruptly rendered a corpse.

Calculate new Quality

Gerard’s Hammer

Gerard’s hammer’s quality is decreased by the damage dealt (6) * .01 * Malleability (1)= .06. His Hammer now has a Quality of 99.94.

Eric’s Armor

The Quality of Eric’s Armor is similarly reduced by .04, leaving his armor at a Quality of 99.91.

Not that he cares.

Wait Before Next Attack

Gerard must now wait Heft (5)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.

Julian attacks Gerard

Julian aims at Gerard

  • Spends Heft (2)/Strength(4) Stamina.
    • Assume minimum of 1. (Julian now has 39 Stamina)

Determine chance to hit

  • Agility(5)*(Skill(5)+Specialization(10))=75
    • Consider Bulk of Plate armor(6) + Shield(2) –(Armor Proficiency (8)+Specialization(32)= -32% chance of failure.
      • this is functionally identical to having a 132% chance of success.
      • no possible random percentage generated is not greater than the chance of failure, action proceeds without being hindered.
      • no chance of failure also means no chance of experience gain.

Calculate target's defense

  • max(Agility or Sapience)(3) *max(Block, Dodge, or Parry)(8) + (Armor Hardness (7) * *Quality(99.97) * (Armor proficiency percent(.08)+Specialization percent (.32))(2.7) =26
    • Mobility(25) is (significantly) greater than Agility.

Determine actual chance to hit

  • base chance to hit(75) –defense (26) =49% chance to hit.
    • There is a 4% chance of a critical hit and a random number of 44-54 will grant Julian an experience point toward his skill.

Random number is generated

49

  • Julian hits, but does not get a Critical Hit.
  • He gains a point of experience towards his skill and specialization.

Deal Damage

  • Base Damage (5) + Strength (4)= 9 * (actual chance to hit (49%) – Random number (49) )(.00)= .00 * Weapon Quality (100%)=.00. Minimum damage of 1
  • Gerard’s health; Gerard’s armor has had its original 4 toughness destroyed by Dierdre, but has his own 4 hit points remaining. Gerard looses one hit point, bringing his total to 3.

Calculate new Quality

Julian’s Sword

Gerard’s hammer’s quality is decreased by the damage dealt (1) * .01 * Malleability (1)= .01. His sword now has a Quality of 99.99.

Gerard’s Armor

The Quality of Gerard’s Armor is similarly reduced by by the damage dealt (1) * .01 * Malleability (1) = .01, leaving his armor at a Quality of 99.96

Wait Before Next Attack

Julian must now wait Heft (3)/Speed(3) seconds before attacking again.
